items.title: Police say UK train stabbing that wounded 10 people not a 'terrorist incident'

Vedika Bahl reports the latest.

items.title: UK: Two Britis arrested for train stabbing, police say not terrorist incident
items.standfirst: Two suspects were arrested after a mass stabbing on a London-bound train late Saturday that left ten people hospitalized, nine of them with potentially life-threatening injuries. Armed officers, supported by police vehicles and numerous ambulances, surrounded the railway station in the rural town of Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire, after the alarm was raised and the train was brought to an emergency stop there. France24 correspondent B√©n√©dicte Paviot tells us the latest.

items.title: UK train stabbings injure nine, police arrest two suspects

items.standfirst: Bodies of missing man and 17-year-old daughter who had fallen 200 metres found on Sunday morning in South TyrolFive German climbers, including a 17-year-old girl, have died after being swept away by an avalanche in the Italian Alps, rescuers have said.Italian media said three groups of climbers ‚Äì believed to have been travelling independently of one another ‚Äì had been caught in the torrent of snow as it pulsed down a mountain near the Swiss border in the north-eastern region of South Tyrol on Saturday. clusters.title: Louvre jewel heist by petty criminals, not organised professionals, says Paris prosecutor
clusters.neutral_headline: Louvre Heist: Petty Criminals, Not Organized Crime

items.title: Louvre jewel heist by petty criminals, not organised professionals, says Paris prosecutor
items.standfirst: Laure Beccuau said ‚Äòupper echelons of organised crime‚Äô unlikely to be involved as one perpetrator remains at largeThe brazen daytime heist at the Louvre was carried out by petty criminals rather than professionals from the world of organised crime, the Paris prosecutor has said, describing two of the suspects as a couple with children.The assertion comes two weeks after thieves parked a stolen truck outside the world‚Äôs most-visited museum, used a furniture lift to reach the first floor, then smashed their way into one of the museum‚Äôs most ornate rooms. Less than seven minutes later, they escaped on scooters with crown jewels worth an estimated ‚Ç¨88m (¬£76m). Continue reading...
items.content: Laure Beccuau said ‚Äòupper echelons of organised crime‚Äô unlikely to be involved as one perpetrator remains at largeThe brazen daytime heist at the Louvre was carried out by petty criminals rather than professionals from the world of organised crime, the Paris prosecutor has said, describing two of the suspects as a couple with children.The assertion comes two weeks after thieves parked a stolen truck outside the world‚Äôs most-visited museum, used a furniture lift to reach the first floor, then smashed their way into one of the museum‚Äôs most ornate rooms. Less than seven minutes later, they escaped on scooters with crown jewels worth an estimated ‚Ç¨88m (¬£76m). Continue reading...

items.title: Louvre heist carried out by petty criminals, prosecutor says
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor says four suspects arrested so far are "clearly local people", not organised crime professionals.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor says four suspects arrested so far are "clearly local people", not organised crime professionals.

items.title: French prosecutor says Louvre heist work of petty criminals, not organised crime
items.standfirst: Paris prosecutor Laure Beccuau told franceinfo radio on Sunday that the audacious daytime robbery of historical jewels worth $102 million from the Louvre did not seem to be associated with "the upper echelons of organised crime", adding that the suspects appear to be locals from a low-income area north of Paris.
items.content: Paris prosecutor Laure Beccuau told franceinfo radio on Sunday that the audacious daytime robbery of historical jewels worth $102 million from the Louvre did not seem to be associated with "the upper echelons of organised crime", adding that the suspects appear to be locals from a low-income area north of Paris.

ai_summary: The Paris prosecutor stated the Louvre heist was likely done by petty criminals.
Four suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft.
The prosecutor said the suspects appear to be locals from a low-income area.
The stolen items were historical jewels worth an estimated $102 million.
The heist occurred during the day, lasting less than seven minutes.

items.title: What the New York mayor‚Äôs race is revealing about the Democratic party
items.standfirst: New Yorkers head to the polls to elect a new mayor on Tuesday, with 34-year-old Zohran Mamdani, a ‚Äúdemocratic socialist‚Äù, the strong favourite to win. His two rivals are the Republican outsider, Curtis Sliwa, and former New York governor Andrew Cuomo. According to our France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert, if Zohran Mamdani wins could be the template for a new type of democratic party going forward.
items.content: New Yorkers head to the polls to elect a new mayor on Tuesday, with 34-year-old Zohran Mamdani, a ‚Äúdemocratic socialist‚Äù, the strong favourite to win. According to our France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert, if Zohran Mamdani wins could be the template for a new type of democratic party going forward.

clusters.title: Russia fires wave of drones and missiles at Ukraine: At least 6 killed
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia fires wave of drones and missiles at Ukraine: At least 6 killed

items.title: Russia fires wave of drones and missiles at Ukraine: At least 6 killed
items.standfirst: Russia launched a barrage of drones and missiles at Ukraine overnight, killing at least six people, including two children, and leaving tens of thousands without power, officials reported Sunday. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attacks, which also injured a dozen others, saying they demonstrated Moscow‚Äôs intent to ‚Äúinflict harm‚Äù on civilians. Despite U.S. calls to end its nearly four-year invasion, Russia has continued both its ground offensive and renewed strikes on Ukraine‚Äôs energy infrastructure. Former Advisor to Ukraine's Defence Ministry, Yuriy Sak, gives his insights.
items.content: Russia launched a barrage of drones and missiles at Ukraine overnight, killing at least six people, including two children, and leaving tens of thousands without power, officials reported Sunday. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attacks, which also injured a dozen others, saying they demonstrated Moscow‚Äôs intent to ‚Äúinflict harm‚Äù on civilians. Despite U.S. calls to end its nearly four-year invasion, Russia has continued both its ground offensive and renewed strikes on Ukraine‚Äôs energy infrastructure. Former Advisor to Ukraine's Defence Ministry, Yuriy Sak, gives his insights.

items.title: Ukraine deploys special forces to Pokrovsk in effort to hold key city
items.standfirst: Escalating battle for city comes as overnight Russian drone and missile strikes kill six people, including two childrenUkraine has deployed special forces to the embattled eastern city of Pokrovsk in an attempt to push back an intense Russian assault involving thousands of troops, Kyiv‚Äôs top commander has said.The escalating battle in the strategically important city comes as an overnight wave of Russian drone and missile attacks on Ukraine killed six people, including two children, and cut power to tens of thousands, officials said on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine deploys special forces to the eastern city of Pokrovsk after a Russian assault
items.standfirst: Ukraine on Saturday deployed special forces to the eastern city of Pokrovsk, which is under an intense Russian assault. The city has been in Moscow's sights for over a year and lies on a major supply route for the Ukrainian army. Russia's army fired 270 missiles over October, up 46 percent on the previous month, according to an AFP analysis. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kharkiv.
items.content: Ukraine on Saturday deployed special forces to the eastern city of Pokrovsk, which is under an intense Russian assault. The city has been in Moscow's sights for over a year and lies on a major supply route for the Ukrainian army. Russia's army fired 270 missiles over October, up 46 percent on the previous month, according to an AFP analysis. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kharkiv.

ai_summary: Russia launched drones and missiles at Ukraine, killing at least six people.
The attacks injured a dozen others and left tens of thousands without power.
Ukraine deployed special forces to Pokrovsk amid an intense Russian assault.
The city of Pokrovsk is a key supply route for the Ukrainian army.
Russia's missile fire increased by 46 percent in the last month.
